messages.message: Code to take clusters and build a classifier wouldn't be too tough (making a UI would take a little bit of time though). The problem with that is that a human still needs to go through and decide what to do with each cluster, so it's almost a "pointless" task anyways. But I say that because rather what we should be doing is building an interface specifically for building up classifiers usefully, and maybe that relies on clusters.

For example, at Citi they were really excited about the idea of user clusterer to do all the classification, but I don't think they were thinking ahead in terms of what they would even do with those clusters afterwards

Yeah I think of it like an auto sort, I have a packet from DHL of 500 or so documents. about 100 are on variant I know, another 100 are another variant, and the remaining 300 or so are a long tail. Cluster would be my easy way to just be like I know the documents look like this so click click click and the remaining i can figure out variants

Personal opinion: Clustering in a production environment is really a human+computer task, and to get mileage weâ€™d want to develop an interactive UI that helps humans understand, edit, and correct the results of whatever automated algorithm we use
heavy human in the loop activity

Right now the Classification app user interface is super basic, it just lists out your classifier files. Maybe we can improve it to something along the following lines: 1) Select folder of docs you want to classify, 2) recommends different classes using the cluster app, 3) user selects and gives names to the clusters they wants to use, 4) we automatically create the base flows and folder structures for those files

This process would probably increase the efficiency of the classification setup phase by a huge amount, and would also serve to help our customers better understand why they might not be able to use just the cluster app
Plus that UI and backend work is relatively straightforward to create, it's just running clusterer and then moving around some files
